ratings.comment: Talks in Spanglish a lo, very knowledgeable about the material, and really cares about his students. Wants participation, but there's not that much room in class for it. Easy if you pay attention and attend class.

Not sure what everyone is raving about. Cudlipp is nice and all, but I could not STAND sitting through this class. He just stands up there and re-reads everything we were supposed to read as homework. Ignores raised hands even though we're supposed to participate. Didn't find any of the readings enjoyable. Take another lit class...

Professor Cudlipp is amazing. I learned so much in his class, partially because the book is really helpful, but mainly because he is a great teacher who is enthusiastic about Spanish. If you have a chance to take one of his courses, do it!!!

Most adorable professor ever. Take his class - he helps you understand and the work is fairly easy and you leave understanding Spanish grammar almost perfectly. Review old homework material for exams.

I've had him before, and he still hasn't changed--a great professor! He tries to make lecture stimulating, but it can be difficult to do. Study the guides for exams very well, take good lecture notes, and you'll be all set on the exams. A few question sets for some of the stories, but giving them enough time beforehand to review will serve you well

Professor Cudlipp is a great man with a terrific sense of humor. Grammar isn't all that interesting, but he maintains a good attitude about it and tries to make students enjoy the material. Didn't really study for the exams, but pulled off an A in the class. Review old homework problems from the packet and you'll be fine. I will take him again.

I love professor Cudlipp! He's extremely nice and friendly and LOVES what he teaches about. Sometimes he just gets so excited, it's really endearing. But he's also an awesome professor, explains things clearly and genuinely wants his students to understand and enjoy the material. Take his class!

He's the best spanish prof I've had; has a genuine interest in the subject and the students. The reading selections are interesting and the tests are fair. I'd definitely recommend taking one of his classes!

class is organized and tests are fair, but this class is PAINFUL. lots of busy work. he speaks in spanglish, which was confusing, frustrating, and downright insulting for an upper level spanish class. it's worth it for the easy A, but painful and boring are the 2 words i would use to describe his class. be prepared.
Very nice, definitely an old school professor.  Always has his pack of Winstons in his front pocket.

He's a very nice person, but his materials are a bit dated; they still say 222 on them. You can tell he's been teaching the class the same way for a long time. Homework and exams are straightforward with no surprises; he gives out a study guide before the exam, so if you pay attention and take good notes, the class is an easy A.
Professor Cudlipp cares a lot about his students and his love of the course material is evident. Every poem is one of his favorites. Take a class taught by him, you won't be disappointed.
Best Spanish professor I've ever had! He cares about his students and really knows his literature! I highly recommend him!

Great guy. Gives thorough and precise explanations, and does not disparage students for different ideas. Clearly knows his materials and is passionate. Great prep for very fair exams. Great choice in reading materials. Sometimes recalls funny things previous students had written.

Aside from being a pretty good teacher, Cudlipp's a really nice guy and really approachable.  We covered a lot of the material he taught  in high school, so the class wasn't too hard.  Just make sure you proofread your essays well.  With corrections though, he'll let you move up a grade and a half.  He also does a great job of helping and explainin

His class is a rather dry and boring one, and he doesn't have many interesting activities. Make sure to check your papers for grammar errors more than once, then have another spanish-speaking friend check it, too. His tests are easy as long as you review the reading and esp. review the homework, as he'll often recycle problems from that. Not bad.

He's a goofy guy and does weird impressions. He's a great teacher, he loves what he's teaching and it shows. This lit class was interesting. We read a lot of fun stories. He's helpful and his grading isn't too bad, he's pretty fair!
